Starting up CITE


Starting up CITE

Starting up XEmacs

  1. /usr/gnu/bin/xemacs & will start up XEmacs.
    If you have made the necessary changes to your .emacs file then this will also load up the necessary CITE files.
  2. Select a file from either the File-->Open menu or the Open toolbar button

Starting up CITE

If the selected file is a Fortran or C file with a .f or .c extension then the toolbar changes to the CITE toolbar. Also a shell window comes up (you can choose to not have the shell window come up) by changing one of the CITE options.

If you have other extensions for your fortran and C files such as a .for or .see then you can add the following to your .emacs file so that CITE toolbar is loaded for files with that extension as well. 

(setq auto-mode-alist
      (append 
	'(("\\.for$"  . fortran-mode)
	  ("\\.see$"  . c-mode))
	auto-mode-alist))
